Status: prototype Playing with tables

Table example 1 (current)

Table 1: Countries of the UK gross disposable household income1, 20152

  GDHI per head (£) GDHI per head growth on 2014(percentage) GDHI per head index (UK=100) Total GDHI (£ million) Total GDHI growth on 2014 (percentage) Share of UK total GDHI (percentage)  
United Kingdom 19,106 2.9 100.0 1,243,970 3.7 100.0      
England 19,447 2.9 101.8 1,065,454 3.8 85.6      
Wales 16,341 3.3 85.5 50,642 3.6 4.1      
Scotland 18,315 2.7 95.9 98,408 3.2 7.9      
Northern Ireland 15,913 3.0 83.3 29,466 3.6 2.4      
Source: Office for National Statistics      
Notes:      
1. Figures may not sum to totals as a result of rounding.  
2. 2015 estimates are provisional.  
             

Table example 1 (version 2)

Table 1: Countries of the UK gross disposable household income (GDHI)1, 20152
  GDHI per head GDHI per head growth on 2014 GDHI per head index (UK equals 100) Total GDHI (£ million) Total GDHI growth on 2014 Share of UK total GDHI
United Kingdom £19,106 2.9% 100.0 1,243,970 3.7% 100.0%
England £19,447 2.9% 101.8 1,065,454 3.8% 85.6%
Wales £16,341 3.3% 85.5 50,642 3.6% 4.1%
Scotland £18,315 2.7% 95.9 98,408 3.2% 7.9%
Northern Ireland £15,913 3.0% 83.3 29,466 3.6% 2.4%
Source: Office for National Statistics. Notes: 1. Figures may not sum to totals as a result of rounding, 2. 2015 estimates are provisional.

Changes made

  • Improve graphic design (spacing, alignment, borders)
  • Use '%' symbol, not 'percent' text
  • Put symbols (£ and %) into the cells instead of the headings
  • Use caption instead of h4 for the table's title
  • Use scope correctly
  • Avoid using empty columns and rows for spacing
  • Combine source info and footnotes into one cell
  • Remove inline styles and auto-generated classes
  • Remove tbody
  • Remove meta tags
  • Remove empty colgroup
  • Remove title attribute from download link/button (not applicable in this example)

Further work to explore

  • Swap axis, so there are fewer columns and more rows
  • Use tfoot for notes (instead of a cell)
  • Improve footnotes
